body_html: @Giszy The previous one should be a better solution, for it avoids the calling of __getattr__ itself when referred to self.conn. Adding the override functions __getstate__ and __setstate__ is only a workground, which has been just mentioned in the link I posted.
body_text: @Giszy The previous one should be a better solution, for it avoids the calling of __getattr__ itself when referred to self.conn. Adding the override functions __getstate__ and __setstate__ is only a workground, which has been just mentioned in the link I posted.
body: @Giszy The previous one should be a better solution, for it avoids the calling of `__getattr__` itself when referred to `self.conn`. Adding the override functions `__getstate__` and `__setstate__` is only a workground, which has been just mentioned in the link I posted.
